intro: Cinnamomum reinwardtii, commonly known as the Bornean cinnamon or wild cinnamon, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the樟科 (Lauraceae) family and is characterized by its aromatic bark and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark purple berries. Its bark is used to make a spice similar to cinnamon, though it is less commonly traded. The tree thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests.
